"Description": "Get information about the groups the current user belongs to (name

"Description": "Get information about potential restricted SIDs applied to the current user."
"Check whether the current user is granted privileges that can be leveraged for local privilege escalation."
"Check whether the current user is granted privileges
column11: through a group policy
column12: that can be leveraged for local privilege escalation."

"Description": "Check whether any environment variables contain sensitive information such as credentials or secrets. Note that this check follows a keyword-based approach and thus might not be completely reliable."
"Get information about third-party services. It does so by parsing the target executable's metadata and checking whether the publisher is Microsoft."
"Get information about third-party kernel drivers. It does so by parsing the driver's metadata and checking whether the publisher is Microsoft."
"Check whether known vulnerable kernel drivers are installed. It does so by computing the file hash of each driver and comparing the value against the list provided by loldrivers.io."
"Check whether the current user has any write permissions on a service through the Service Control Manager (SCM)."
"Check whether the current user has any write permissions on the configuration of a service in the registry."
"Check whether the current user has any write permissions on a service's binary or its folder."
"Check whether there are services configured with an exploitable unquoted path that contains spaces."
"Check whether the current user has any write permissions on the Service Control Manager (SCM)."
"Get information about non-default and third-party applications by searching the registry and the default install locations."
"Check whether the current user has any write permissions on non-default or third-party applications."
"Check whether the current user has any write permissions on a non-default "ProgramData" folder. This check is purely informative and the results require manual analysis."
"Check whether the current user has any write permissions on system-wide applications that are run at startup for all users."
"Get information about the currently running processes that are not owned by the current user. Processes such as 'svchost.exe' are filtered out."
"Check whether the current user has any write permissions on a scheduled task's binary or its folder. Note that low-privileged users cannot list all the scheduled tasks."
"Check whether there are scheduled tasks configured with an exploitable unquoted path. Note that low-privileged users cannot list all the scheduled tasks."
"Check whether the current user has read permissions on the SAM/SYSTEM/SECURITY files in the system folder (CVE-2021-36934 - HiveNightmare)."
"Check whether the current user has read permissions on the SAM/SYSTEM/SECURITY files stored in volume shadow copies (CVE-2021-36934 - HiveNightmare)."
"Check whether there are any 'unattend' files and whether they contain clear-text credentials."
"Check whether the 'WinLogon' registry key contains clear-text credentials. Note that entries with an empty password field are filtered out."
"Get information about the current user's CREDENTIAL files."
"Check whether the current user's credential vault contains any clear-text Windows passwords."
"Check whether the current user's credential vault contains any clear-text web passwords."
"Check whether there are cached Group Policy Preference (GPP) files that contain clear-text passwords."
"Check whether the current user's PowerShell history contains any clear-text credentials. Note that this check follows a keyword-based approach and thus might not be completely reliable."
"Check whether SCCM NAA credentials are stored in the WMI repository. If so
column11: the username and password DPAPI blobs are returned
column12: but can only be decrypted using the SYSTEM's DPAPI user key."

"Description": "Check whether the SCCM cache folders contain files with potentially hard coded credentials
column11: or secrets

"Description": "Check whether User Access Control (UAC) is enabled and whether it filters the access token of local administrator accounts when they authenticate remotely."
"Check whether LSA protection is enabled. Note that when LSA protection is enabled
column11: 'lsass.exe' runs as a Protected Process Light (PPL) and thus can only be accessed by other protected processes with an equivalent or higher protection level."

"Description": "Check whether Credential Guard is supported and enabled. Note that when Credential Guard is enabled
column11: credentials are stored in an isolated process ('LsaIso.exe') that cannot be accessed
column12: even if the kernel is compromised."

"Description": "Get information about configured Windows Defender Exploit Guard Attack Surface Reduction (ASR) rules."
"Check whether UEFI and Secure Boot are supported and enabled. Note that Secure Boot requires UEFI."
"Check whether LAPS is configured and enabled. Note that this applies to domain-joined machines only."
"Check whether PowerShell Transcription is configured and enabled."
"Check whether a PowerShell script execution policy is enforced."

"Check whether BitLocker is enabled on the system drive and requires a second factor of authentication (PIN or startup key). Note that this check might yield a false positive if a third-party drive encryption software is installed."
"Check whether an AppLocker policy is enforced."
"Check whether AppLocker rules can be exploited
column11: in the context of the current user

"Description": "Check whether file extensions such as '.bat' or '.wsh' are associated to a text editor. Note that only basic text editors such as 'Notepad' are detected. If a rich text editor is set instead
column11: this check could yield false positives."

"Description": "Check whether extensions of known file types are shown or hidden in the Explorer."
"Check whether the current user has any write permissions on the system-wide PATH folders. If so
column11: the system could be vulnerable to privilege escalation through ghost DLL hijacking."

"Description": "Get information about services that are known to be prone to ghost DLL hijacking. Note that their exploitation requires the current user to have write permissions on at least one system-wide PATH folder."
"Check whether the 'AlwaysInstallElevated' policy is enabled system-wide and for the current user. If so
column11: the current user may install a Windows Installer package with elevated (SYSTEM) privileges."

"Description": "Check whether WSUS uses the HTTPS protocol to retrieve updates from the on-premise update server. If WSUS uses the clear-text HTTP protocol
column11: it is vulnerable to MitM attacks that may result in remote code execution as SYSTEM."

"Description": "Check whether sensitive UNC paths are properly hardened. Note that non-hardened UNC paths used for retrieving group policies can be hijacked through an MitM attack to obtain remote code execution as SYSTEM."
"Check whether SMBv1 is enabled (server)
column11: and whether signing is required (server and client)."

"Description": "Check whether the Print Spooler service is enabled and if the Point and Print configuration allows non-administrator users to install printer drivers."
"Check whether Driver Co-installers are disabled. A local user might be able to gain SYSTEM privileges by plugging in a device such as a mouse or keyboard with a vulnerable Driver Co-installer."
"Get information about SCCM cache folders (incl. number and list of binary
column11: script

"Description": "Check whether a proxy auto config URL is set
column11: and whether the proxy.pac file is retrieved over HTTP."

"Description": "Get information about the exclusions configured in Microsoft Defender."
"Get information about all active Ethernet adapters."
"Get information about all the TCP ports that are in a LISTEN state. Note that the associated process is also listed."
"Get information about all the UDP ports that are in a LISTEN state. Note that the associated process is also listed. DNS is filtered out to minimize the output."
"Get information about saved Wi-Fi profiles. Clear-text pre-shared keys (PSK) are displayed when possible
column11: and potentially vulnerable 802.1x profiles are listed."

"Description": "Check whether the 'Do not display network selection UI' policy is enabled on workstations (CVE-2021-28316 - Airstrike attack)."
"Get information about the latest Windows update. Note that this check might be unreliable."
"Check whether a Windows security update was installed within the last 31 days."
"Get information about cached MSI files that execute potentially unsafe Custom Actions. Note that a manual analysis is required to determine if the returned MSI files are actually vulnerable."
"Get information about the installed security products (AV
column11: EDR). Note that this check follows a keyword-based approach and thus might not be completely reliable."

"Description": "Get information about the Windows version. Note that this information might be useful if the update history cannot be obtained."
"Get information about the users and groups in the local 'Administrators' group."
"Get information about the currently logged-on users. Note that it might be possible to capture or relay the NTLM/Kerberos authentication of these users (RemotePotato0
column11: KrbRelay)."

"Description": "Get information about the local home folders and check whether the current user has read or write permissions."
"Get information about the machine's role. Is it a Workstation
column11: a Server

"Description": "Get information about the startup history. Note that this information might be useful if the exploitation of a service requires a reboot but the current user does not have the privileges to shut down the system."
"Get information about the partitions
column11: removable storages

"Description": "Check whether the current user has any write permissions on other users' named pipes."
"Check whether the current user has access to a process that contains a leaked handle to a privileged object such as a process
column11: thread or file."
